document_title: Dragon worm disease: Causes, signs, treatment measures
subsection_content: Diagnosis of the disease is usually based on clinical symptoms such as: clearly seeing adult dragon worms burrowing under the skin, and in the ulcerated skin area, the head of the female dragon worm appears. X-rays can be taken to detect calcified worms in the host's body. Blood tests or examination of wound secretions can be done to diagnose. If you see increased eosinophilia in the blood and larvae in the wound secretions, you have dragonworm disease.
subsection_data:
benh giun rong.json. Diagnostic method
Diagnosis of the disease is usually based on clinical symptoms such as: clearly seeing adult dragon worms burrowing under the skin, and in the ulcerated skin area, the head of the female dragon worm appears. X-rays can be taken to detect calcified worms in the host's body. Blood tests or examination of wound secretions can be done to diagnose. If you see increased eosinophilia in the blood and larvae in the wound secretions, you have dragonworm disease.
